sentences.sentence: The Goose( 鹅 ) Girl
Once upon a time there was an old Queen, whose husband had been dead for many years.
She had a beautiful daughter, who was promised in marriage to a King’s son who lived a long way away.
When the time for the wedding( 婚礼 ) drew near, and the old Queen had to send her daughter away,
she got together many costly( 昂贵的 ) things—furniture( 家具 ) and cups and jewels( 宝石 ) and beautiful things of all kinds, both of gold and silver.
There was everything suitable( 适宜的 ) for the dowry( 嫁妆 ) of a royal Princess( 公主 ), because she loved her daughter dearly( 非常 ).
She gave her also a female servant to go with her and take care of her until she was safely married.
They each had a horse for the journey.
The Princess’s horse was named Falada, and he could speak.
When the time came for the Princess to leave, the old Queen took her daughter to her room, and with a little knife she cut her own finger so that it bled.
She held a white cloth( 布 ) beneath( 在...下方 ) it, and on the cloth fell three drops of blood.
She gave the cloth to her daughter, and asked her take care of it, because she would need it along the way.
Then they said goodbye.
The Princess hid the cloth inside her dress, got on her horse, and set out to meet her new husband.
After she had ridden an hour, she began to feel very thirsty, and she said to her servant,
“Get down, and fill my cup with water from that stream( 小溪 ), because I am very thirsty.”
“Get down yourself,” said the servant. “Who do you think I am—your slave( 奴隶 )?”
And as her thirst was so great, the Princess had to get off her horse, kneel( 跪下 ) down, and drink from the stream—using her hands, because her servant had the golden cup.
“What is happening here?” said the poor Princess.
And the three drops of blood heard her, and said,
“If your mother knew of this, it would break her heart.”
But the Princess did not reply, and quietly got back on her horse again.
So they rode on for some miles.
The day was warm, the sun was hot, and the Princess grew thirsty once more.
And when they came to a river, she called again to her servant, and said,
“Get down, and give me a drink out of my golden cup.”
For she had forgotten all that had gone before.
But the waiting-woman spoke still more proudly and said,
“If you want a drink, you may get it yourself; I am not going to be your slave.”
So, as her thirst was so great, the Princess had to get off her horse and kneel beside the running water to drink.
And as she knelt, she cried and said, “Oh, no!”
And the three drops of blood heard her and answered,
“If your mother knew of this, it would break her heart!”
And as she bent( 俯身 ) down to drink, the cloth with the three drops of blood on it fell out of the front of her dress and floated( 漂 ) down the stream.
She did not notice it, because she was so upset( 难过的 )—but her servant did. She knew that now she had power over the Princess.
Now that the Princess had lost the three drops of blood, she had become weak, and was unable to defend( 保护 ) herself.
And when she was going to get back on her horse again, her servant shouted at her,
“Falada belongs( 属于 ) to me, and this old horse to you.”
And the Princess had no choice but to take the old horse.
Then the servant ordered the Princess, with many hard words, to take off her rich clothing and to put on the servant’s clothes.
Then she made her promise to say nothing of what had happened when they came to the royal court—threatening( 威胁 ) to take her life if she refused.
And the horse Falada noticed and remembered everything.

article_info.previous: 国王不明真相，命令猎人杀掉小王子。正直的猎人放走了小王子，小王子远走他乡。被小王子所救的国家送来礼物以表感谢。事情的真相浮出水面，国王后悔不已，派人四处寻找小王子。最后小王子和公主有情人终成眷属，和国王也重归于好。两个哥哥也得到了相应的惩罚。
article_info.share_words: She had a beautiful daughter, who was promised in marriage to a King’s son who lived a long way away.

question.cn: 下列关于Falada的说法中，哪一项是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements about Falada was true?

analysis: 文中提到：“The Princess’s horse was named Falada, and he could speak.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 下列哪个词可以用来描述女仆？
question.en: Which of the following words could be used to describe the servant girl?

analysis: 由原文可知，当公主命令女仆去取水时，女仆不仅不听从命令，还出言不逊，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 公主为什么没注意到那块布漂走了？
question.en: Why didn’t the Princess notice the cloth floated away?

analysis: 文中提到：“She did not notice it, because she was so upset—but her servant did.” 因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第98天
